title.narrative: Physical Security and Stockpile Management (PSSM) in Burkina Faso in Support of Improved National and Regional Security

description.narrative: The goal of this project is to contribute to improved security and stability in Burkina Faso and in the Sahel through the effective management of state-held weapons and ammunition. MAG will work to reduce the risk of illicit proliferation of weapons and ammunition through improved physical security at gendarmerie, police, and military storage facilities and destruction of obsolete and unserviceable weapons and ammunition. 30 armories/weapons facilities are scheduled to be built/refurbished, and all available small arms ammunition (SAA) and small arms and light weapons (SALW) will be destroyed and all identified weapons will be marked (4,800). The project will also improve the capacity of national security forces to safely handle, manage, and store weapons and ammunition through the delivery of Armory Storekeeping and Management training course to 84 personnel. Lastly, MAG will conduct additional technical assessments of PSSM needs at 30 weapons/ammunition storage facilities.
